intro: Phyllanthus tenuipedicellatus var. tenuipedicellatus, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed phyllanthus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, simple leaves that are often opposite or alternate in arrangement. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers, which are typically surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. This species is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests or along stream banks.
